member.summary: Adds a logger, which allows for logging of executed SQL commands.

This currently only includes the following API's:
QuerySingle
QueryBatch
QueryAsync
Also consider configuring the property.

member.name: T:Venflow.Enums.ForeignTruncateOptions
member.summary: Represents the truncate option for foreign keys.

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.ForeignTruncateOptions.None
member.summary: Does nothing.

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.ForeignTruncateOptions.Cascade
member.summary: Automatically truncate all tables that have foreign-key references to any of the named tables, or to any tables added to the group due to CASCADE.

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.ForeignTruncateOptions.Restrict
member.summary: Refuse to truncate if any of the tables have foreign-key references from tables that are not listed in the command. This is the default.

member.name: T:Venflow.Enums.IdentityTruncateOptions
member.summary: Represents the identity truncate option for foreign keys.

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.IdentityTruncateOptions.None
member.summary: Does nothing.

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.IdentityTruncateOptions.Restart
member.summary: Automatically restart sequences owned by columns of the truncated table(s).

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.IdentityTruncateOptions.Continue
member.summary: Do not change the values of sequences. This is the default.

member.name: T:Venflow.Enums.JoinBehaviour
member.summary: Specifies the behavior for a specific join between two tables.

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.JoinBehaviour.InnerJoin
member.summary: Returns records that have matching values in both tables

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.JoinBehaviour.LeftJoin
member.summary: Returns all records from the left table, and the matched records from the right table

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.JoinBehaviour.RightJoin
member.summary: Returns all records from the right table, and the matched records from the left table

member.name: F:Venflow.Enums.JoinBehaviour.FullJoin
member.summary: Returns all records when there is a match in either left or right table

member.name: M:Venflow.Modeling.Definitions.Builder.ILeftRelationBuilder`1.HasOne``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}})

summary.para: Configures a relationship where this entity type has a reference that points to a single instance of the other type in the relationship.

Note that calling this method with no parameters will explicitly configure this side of the relationship to use no navigation property, even if such a property exists on the entity type. If the navigation property is to be used, then it must be specified.
After calling this method, you should chain a call to or to fully configure the relationship. Calling just this method without the chained call will not produce a valid relationship.

member.typeparam: The entity type that this relationship targets.
member.param: A lambda expression representing the reference navigation property on this entity type that represents the relationship (post => post.Blog). If no property is specified, the relationship will be configured without a navigation property on this end.
member.returns: An object that can be used to configure the relationship.

member.name: M:Venflow.Modeling.Definitions.Builder.ILeftRelationBuilder`1.HasMany``1

summary.para: Configures a relationship where this entity type has a collection that contains instances of the other type in the relationship.

Note that calling this method will explicitly configure this side of the relationship to use no navigation property, even if such a property exists on the entity type. If the navigation property is to be used, then it must be specified.
After calling this method, you should chain a call to to fully configure the relationship. Calling just this method without the chained call will not produce a valid relationship.

member.returns: An object that can be used to configure the relationship.

member.name: P:Venflow.VenflowConfiguration.DynamicCacheExpirationTime
member.summary: Determines the expiration duration time of the underlying SQL Materializer Cache in seconds, defaults to 5 minutes.
member.remarks: Venflow uses the SQL used in queries to map a materializer to this specific query. This is faster, than using the returned columns and used relations as a cache key. If a query with the executed SQL won't be called again within the next , it will be removed from the cache. However do note, that the materializer itself will not be removed from the cache.
